required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Radio/Pathological Evaluation of Tongue Cancer Infiltration
clinical_study.official_title: An Evaluation of the Radio/Pathological Correlation of Depth Of Invasion for Oral Squamous Cell Carcinoma, a Retrospective Study in a University Hospital in Lyon

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to assess the good correlation and prediction of the DOI for the post-operative pathological results and prognosis.

primary_outcome.measure: The primary outcome will be the measure of the correlation of the depth of invasion on the radiological pre operative images and of the pathological analyses on the resection piece.
primary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome will be measured at the inclusion of the patient in the current study.
primary_outcome.description: With a Bland Altman analysis we will assess the good correlation between the pre and post operatory mesures of the depth of invasion in the oral squamous cell carcioma

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients who improved surgical treatment for oral cavity cancer
arm_group.description: T1 T2 and T3 OSCC tumor, patients who have a recent evaluation cervico thoracic scanner in their medical files.

intervention.description: We will analyse the pre operative scannographic and MRI (if available) images, and the post operative pathological analyses. The scanners will be reviewed by 2 well trained clinicians (one head and neck radiologist and one head and neck surgeon). Then we will analyse the correlation between the radiological and the pathological analysis.
intervention.arm_group_label: Patients who improved surgical treatment for oral cavity cancer

study_pop.textblock:
The population will include all the patients chirurgically treated for an OSCC for 2014 to 2019, who have a pre operativ scanner at least in their medical file.
We will exclude the T4, the patients with very artefacted exams, and those with R+ resections.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients chirurgically treated for an OSCC
- T1 T2 T3
- CT scanner in their medical file
Exclusion Criteria:
- T4
- R+ r√©section
- Artefacts on CT scanner
